data.title: And speaking of Alabama and financial trouble...
data.meta_description: (see the previous entry if that title doesn't make sense to you) \n Not a good way to start off a marriage: nearly $200,000 in debt to the state and federal government. \n Season two American Idol winnâ€¦
data.text:
(see the previous entry if that title doesn't make sense to you)

Not a good way to start off a marriage: nearly $200,000 in debt to the state and federal government.

Season two American Idol winner and newlywed Ruben Studdard (he married Surata Zuri McCants on June 28) was hit with property liens last week for allegedly failing to pay $171,920 to the federal government and $21,730 to the state of Alabama.

From the Associated Pess: Court papers filed in Birmingham, Alabama, say both the federal government and the state of Alabama are taking steps to get their money from the former "American Idol" champ. They have been liens placed on all of Studdard's property for unpaid income taxes in 2003 and 2005.

A lawyer for Studdard says the singer is in good shape financially and can afford to pay his outstanding tax bill. Meanwhile, a developer is trying to find out if the liens on Studdard's property might affect the singer's promised investment in a planned downtown Birmingham club bearing his name.
